titles.title: Two Strikes and You're Out Comprehensive Consequences for Child Molesters Act
To amend title 18 of the United States Code to provide life imprisonment for repeat offenders who commit sex offenses against children.
Two Strikes and You're Out Comprehensive Consequences for Child Molesters Act

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on the Judiciary.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Crime, Terrorism, and Homeland Security.

bill.summary: Two Strikes and You're Out Comprehensive Consequences for Child Molesters Act - Amends the Federal criminal code to: (1) provide for mandatory life imprisonment (unless a death sentence is imposed) of a person convicted of a Federal sex offense in which a minor is the victim if the person has a prior sex conviction in which a minor was the victim; and (2) make the authorized term of supervised release any term of years or life for the offenses of kidnaping a victim who has not attained age 18 and for sexual abuse, sexual exploitation of children, transportation for illegal sexual activity (generally), and sex trafficking of children.
